deck: Trebia Riljeigh of Buenapar is a historian/heroine of the universe in the 30th Century who has once made contact with members of the Legion of Super-Heroes.
description:
Trebia Rijleigh of the planet Buenapar is a historian and member of the Society of Historical Speculation, whom call themselves "knights".

Following her psuedo-vid presentation of her version of the War of Roses, the Society presented Trebia with her very own sword and armor. While the sword itself is a recreation, through Trebia it comes alive by her very own power, granting her strength and endurance beyond those of normal people. Stories of her accomplishments as "the Silver Sword" have passed throughout various academic communities, and many members of SHS branches have travelled to meet and fight Trebia in play combat. Trebia has bested them all, including cyborgs programmed to fight.

For the reasons mentioned above, Trebia was abducted by Universo's agents after she busted an illegal trading ring under Universo's supervision. Brainwashed and placed amongst various other superheroes in a slave colony, Trebia would be freed from Universo's control by a quartet of Legionnaires. After helping to demolish the slave colony, Trebia returned to her home planet, where she continues to have adventures as the Silver Sword.
name: Silver Sword

volume_credits.name: Who's Who in the Legion of Super-Heroes

deck: Energax is the title given to the planetary champion of Chisshagh, a planet of energy manipulating beings in the 30th Century. A notable holder of this title is Hisshkul.
description:
The passing of the title of Energax, sworn protector of the planet, is a sacred and celebrated act among the beings of Chisshagh. Hundreds of inhabitants gathered in the worlds largest coliseum to watch the handpicked contestants vie for the prestigious honor. The competition began, and then the arena exploded.

No one was quite sure what happened to detonate the stadium, but foul play was heavily suspected. One contender for the title, Hisshkul, was late for the competition due to vehicle issues, and was soundly captured and imprisoned by Universo (his quick capture of the alien suggests Universo himself blew up the stadium) for his war on the Controllers.

Under the hypnotic influence of Universo, Hisshkul and the other captives could do little to free themselves. Luckily, Saturn Girl was one of the Legionnaires Universo had captured, and her telepathic abilities allowed her to lift the hold Universo had on the others heroes. Hisshkul carried his own in the battle against Universo and his forces, and afterwards was transported back to his homeworld by one of his new friends, The Silver Sword.

Upon his return to Chisshagh, he was hailed a returning champion: that he had survived his ordeal was enough to prove to his people he was truly worthy of the title of Energax. Presumably, Hisshkul served his people up until the rebooting of the universe from the Zero Hour event.

issue_credits.name: Dr. Mayavale thru High Seer of Naltor

name: Energax

volume_credits.name: Who's Who in the Legion of Super-Heroes

deck: Xera Kharindot is the royal princess and protector of Manna-5. She is a superhero in the 30th century and has power over the elements.
description:
Xera Kharindot is the hereditary successor of an ability to control and manipulate the elements. She is the princess of Manna-5, the heir of two royal bloodlines combined, each one worshiping a different nature goddess. Xera must perform seasonal rituals in order to honor the two goddesses her family worships, and to renew her abilities, as had every champion before her.

She cannot leave Manna-5 for more than a year or her abilities will fade. It's for this reason that she hasn't shown an interest in joining the Legion of Super-Heroes or any other off-world organization. But she has shown interest in searching for a man with inheritable powers that can increase the strength of her bloodline.

Xera was one of many heroes who were kidnapped and brainwashed by Universo during his scheme to control Earth and outlaw the Legion. Upon her release, Xera showed interest in some of the male captives, but she found none to her liking. At the time she decided that it would be in both her best interests and the interests of her planet to perform more diplomatic journeys to other planets.

Eventually, Xera joined the Legion Academy. Whether this means she had changed her mind about joining the Legion of Super-Heroes or perhaps just wanted to learn how use her powers better was not revealed.

During the "Five Years Later" continuity of the Legion, Xera was a member of the United Planets Military Academy alongside the former members of the Legion of Substitute Heroes, former Legionnaires Bouncing Boy and Duo Damsel, and the former members of the Legion Academy. This timeline has since been wiped out and Xera has not appeared since.
name: Xera

volume_credits.name: Who's Who in the Legion of Super-Heroes

deck: Westerner is a student in the Legion Academy. He has the ability to absorb the strength and endurance of others. His power is mystic in origin.
description:
HISTORY

POST-CRISIS ON INFINITE EARTHS

Westerner was a member of the Santoza family, a clan that had been inheritors of an ancient, mystical power for generations. The details of it's origins are lost, but it's effects are clear from point of activation: the power allows its user to draw strength and endurance from those around him and use it for himself.

 

While this may sound like a godsend, Timothy was not capable of properly harnessing the power. After being taught the finer points of control by a shaman, Santoza applied for the Legion Academy as the Westerner. He was present for the Legion's investigation into the shooting of Laurel Kent, and on several of the cadets training-missions. However, he never really managed to shine enough to qualify for Legion membership. After the disbanding of the Legion, Santoza did some commercials for television and some teaching work on the outermost frontier colonies.

deck: Rhent Ustin is a four-eyed mutant at the Legion Academy. His homeworld in unknown.
description:
When he was a infant, Rhent Ustin was found in front of a child-care facility in Lehrton on earth. Extensive research into his vision powers was inconclusive, but was determined to be from a mutation rather than any surgical tampering or genetic alteration.

Rhent was raised by the Ustins, foster parents who were curious about, but not frightened by his strange eyes. They taught him to control his strange powers, which include heat vision, hypnotic vision, telescopic vision, and microscopic vision. These powers come from using his four eyes in different combinations, and Rhent may have many more combinations and abilities that he has not discovered yet.

Rhent grew up hearing about the Legion of Super-Heroes and decided early on that he would become a member when he grew up. So when he was old enough, Rhent applied to and was accepted into the Legion Academy as Visi-Lad.

deck: The famous Master Roshi was sought out by a young Goku, and after some... Persuading... He agreed to teach the boy.
description:
Origin

Master Roshi was the world's greatest martial artist until he trained the world's greatest hero Goku. Master Roshi is a turtle hermit who lives on Small island in the middle of the Ocean called Kame island. Master Roshi met Son Goku and Bulma after he returned Turtle back to Kame island. As a gift Roshi gave Goku a flying nimbus. Later on Master Roshi decided to train Goku as his student after seeing his great potential by attempting Master Roshis Kamehameha wave. Roshi later decided to take another student in under his tutelage named Krillin. For the next 3 years Roshi trained Goku and Krillin for the world martial arts tournament. Goku eventually left for a year to train on his own.

Powers and Abilities

Master Roshi is the head and founder of the Turtle School and at one point the Worlds most powerful man. Roshi has developed a great number of martial and energy attacks making him very versital in battle, though his age can hamper him in battle with more youthful opponents. Roshi is shown to be an insightful and wise, if perverted, master. Roshi, disguised as Jackie Chun, was able to defeat both his students and become the World Champion at an advanced age. While later eclipsed by his students and retiring from active fighting by the end of Dragonball, Roshi remains a powerful master and way ahead of any normal human in terms of skill and power.

Techniques

Bound Technique - A technique where Roshi binds the arms and feet of his opponent.

Drunken Fist - Roshi begins to act drunk and stumbles across the battlefield utilizing odd movements to attack unprepared opponents.

Hypnosis Technique - Utilizing a number of hand movements Roshi can hypnotize opponents into sleep or into taking actions he would like.

Jan Ken Fist - One of the Turtle Schools early attacks. The user calls out the name and then adds either rock, scissor, or paper are corresponds with either a punch(rock), eye stab(scissor), or slap(paper).

Kamehameha Wave - The signature technique of the Turtle School that Roshi invented himself. Roshi has shown enough power to blow up to blow up Fire Mountain.

Pressure Point Attack - Roshi is able to use pressure points to paralyze his opponents.

Telepathy - Roshi is able to communicate via telepathy and read the minds of his opponents.

Thunder Shock Surprise - Roshi's most deadly move where he releases a large electric shock from hsi palms and entraps an opponent who can not escape. This move is very deadly and Roshi prefers not to use it.

Forms

50% Max Power form - Roshi's normally old form gains muscle mass on par with a trained martial artist. Roshi used this form to fight Tien during the 22nd World Martial Arts Tournament.

100% Max Power Form - Roshi gains a large amount of muscle mass, looking like a hulking monster on par with Broly. This is Roshi's max power. He loses his speed and agility though gains strength.

Other Media

Video Games

Dragon Ball: Advanced Adventure - Master Roshi as Jackie Chun appears as a boss during the 21st World Martial Arts Tournament. He is then a playable character during free play mode.

Dragon Ball: Online - When Gohan publishes his book explaining the science behind ki, both the Turtle School and Crane Schools become popular once again. Master Roshi officially retires making Krillin the new head of the Turtle School. Diciples of the Turtle School can learn Master Roshi's Kamhameha Wave along with Yamcha's Wolf Fang Fist, and Krillin's Destructo Disk.

Dragon Ball: Origins - Master Roshi is an optional boss for Goku to fight and his a required boss in the guise of Jackie Chun during the 21st World Martial Arts Tournament.

Dragon Ball: Origins 2 - Master Roshi appears as an optional boss.

Dragon Ball: Revenge of King Piccolo - Master Roshi as Jackie Chun appears as a playable character.

Dragon Ball Z: Budokai - Master Roshi appears in several cutscenes during the story mode.

Dragon Ball Z: Budokai 3 - Master Roshi can be spoken to in the story mode.

Dragon Ball Z: Budokai Tenkaichi - Master Roshi appears as a playable fighter.

Dragon Ball Z: Budokai Tenkaichi 2 - Master Roshi appears as a playable fighter. His Jackie Chun costume is an alternate outfit and his 100% Max Power form is his transformation.

Dragon Ball Z: Budokai Tenkaichi 3 - Master Roshi appears as a playable fighter. His Jackie Chun costume is an alternate outfit and his 100% Max Power form is his transformation.

Dragon Ball Z: The Legacy of Goku - Master Roshi appears during Story mode.

Dragon Ball Z: The Legacy of Goku - Master Roshi appears on his island at the Kame House during the start of the Saiyan Saga when Raditz kidnaps Gohan.

deck: Quan Chi is likely the most sinister character in the Mortal Kombat universe. A powerful sorcerer and demon from the Netherrealm, Quan Chi is a master manipulator. He is responsible for killing Scorpion's family, and blaming it on the original Sub-Zero, causing the two ninjas to murder each other. He then would resurrect them both as wraiths to serve him in hell. Quan Chi himself serves the fallen Elder God Shinnok, but not without having a hidden agenda on his own.
description:
Pre Mortal Kombat

Quan Chi's past is shrouded in mystery, he is believed to be from the Netherealm though this is unknown. What is know is that Quan Chi was a roaming sorcerer who happened to stumble upon the fallen Elder God Shinnok who was being tortured and imprisoned by the Netherealm's current ruler Lucifer. Shinnok promised power to Quan Chi if he could release him and help him fight Lucifer. Quan Chi was constantly searching for power so he accepted the Elder God's proposal and together they overthrew Lucifer and claimed the Netherealm in Shinnok's name.

Quan Chi then became the arch-sorcerer of the Netherealm and one of the most powerful magic users in any realm. Quan Chi was then tasked with locating and retrieving Shinnok's lost amulet so he could regain some measure of his former power. The amulets location was only know to high ranking Shaolin Monks so Quan Chi departed for Outworld to speak to Shang Tsung. Shang Tsung had absorbed the soul of the Great Kung Lao, a Shaolin Monk and champion of Mortal Kombat, in exchange for the information Quan Chi agreed to help Shao Kahn's cause against Earthrealm at a later date.

Quan Chi was directed towards the Temple of the Elements which was located somewhere in the Himalayas. What Shang Tsung failed ot tell Quan Chi was that no sorcerer could enter this temple so Quan Chi would need to recruit a powerful warrior to retreive it for him. Quan Chi located the Lin Kuei and bargained to have one of their warriors storm the temple and in return Quan Chi would use his magic to wipeout the Shirai Ryu clan. The Lin Kuei accepted his proposal and sent the elder Sub-Zero to storm the temple. Unknown to Sub-Zero or the Lin Kuei, Quan Chi made the same offer to the Shirai Ryu who sent a ninja named Hanzo Hasashi after the amulet.

Sub-Zero was the one to retreive the amulet and he killed Hanzo in cold bold during the raid. Quan Chi then return to the Netherealm with the amulet to further prepare Shinnok's forces though he did murder all of the Shirai Ryu clan. Sub-Zero was then tasked by Raiden to retreive the amulet from Shinnok and Quan Chi was left to fight him along with his former assassin Sareena. They defeated the sorcerer and Shinnok to retrieve the amulet, though Quan Chi had pulled a fast one and gave Shinnok a copy of the amulet and kept the real one himself.

Quan Chi would spend the following years helping Shinnok amass power and leading the Brotherhood of the Shadow Cult that worshipped the Elder God. Quan Chi would resurrect souls bound to the Netherealm for Shinnok's army of demons. The most notable was the ninja Hanzo Hasashi who would become Quan Chi's personal enforcer Scorpion.

Mortal Kombat 4

Shinnok and Quan Chi were ready to invade after Shao Kahn's failed invasion attempt of Earthrealm. Outworld, Earthrealm, and Edenia all had become vulnerable and Shinnok believed it was time to strike. Quan Chi and Netherealm demons posed as refuges' seeking asylum in Edenia. With the ambasadores daughter Tanya, secretly a member of Shinnok's cult, vouching for their authenticity they were granted an audience with Queen Sindel. When his story did not match up Quan Chi gave Sindel an orb that kept her in a trance like state.

This invasion pushed the struggling Edenia over the edge since they still had not recovered from Shao Kahn's occupation causing Kitana to request Earthrealm's aid in repealing Shinnok. Once the battle was underway Quan Chi assinged Scorpion to kill the younger Sub-Zero, though this backfired when Scorpion learned Quan Chi was the one responsible for the murder of his family and clan. Quan Chi attempted to banish the ninja spectre though Scorpion was able to grab a hold of Quan Chi before the spell was cast sending them both to the lowest pits of the Netherealm. Scorpion would enjoy torturing the sorcerer for all eternity.

Mortal Kombat Deadly Alliance

Quan Chi would wander then Netherealm as Scorpion constantly hunted his former master for revenge. Quan Chi ran into two Oni named Moloch and Drahmin who were natives of the Netherealm. He bargained their freedom from this hell in exchange they would protect him from Scorpion. They did just that and Scorpion was fended off long enough for Quan Chi to find a portal to Outworld though he left the two Oni in the Netherealm creating more enemies for later. When Quan Chi arrived in Outworld he arrived in the long forgotten tomb of the Dragon King.

After studying the scrolls and hieroglyphics Quan Chi found a way to ressurect the mummified remains of his army though he would need the help of another sorcerer, Shang Tsung. Once Quan Chi reached Shang Tsung's palace in Outworld he was ambushed by Scorpion who had escaped the Netherealm. The fight alerted Shang Tsung to their presence, but Quan Chi was able to drive off Scorpion for the time being. Quan Chi made his proposal to raise the Dragon King's army and he would open a soulnado to the heavens using Shinnok's amulet giving Shang Tsung an endless supply of souls which would grant him immortality. The agreed to work together and the Deadly Alliance was formed.

The Alliance's first target was to eliminate the two greatest threats to their cause, Shao Kahn and Liu Kang. In a feigned plea of loyalty during an audience with the Emperor Quan Chi and Shang Tsung jumped and killed the Emperor of Outworld and gained Kano as a follower. They then traveled through a portal to Earthrealm where Shang Tsung impersonated Kung lao to get close to Liu Kang.

During their fight Liu had the upper hand until Quan Chi struck him from behind allowing Shang Tsung to break Liu Kang's neck and absorb his soul. After returning to Outworld Kano's troops capture a small Outworld village and forced the inhabitants to build a palace to house the massive soulnado the Shang Tsung needed. When a villager named Li Mei attacked Kano Quan Chi and Shang Tsung offered to free her people should she win a tournament against some of Kano's Black Dragons.

This was merely a distraction to keep her from causing riots among the workers. They also hired the Red Dragon Mavado to eliminate the blind swordsman Kenshi who was spying on Shang Tsung, in return they would turn over Kano for Mavado to kill. Mavado was succesful in mortally wounding Kenshi and did receive Kano as a prize. Li Mei also was able to win her tournament and demanded her prize.

She was going to have her soul transferred into one of the Dragon King's soldiers when the Earthrealm warriors arrived and interrupted the process. Bo Rai Cho escaped with Li Mei while the rest fought off the Deadly Alliance and their Tarkatan hordes. The Earthrealm warriors would fail and be slain that day, Quan Chi was able to fight and kill Princess Kitana one on one. Leaving the Thunder God Raiden to fight the Deadly Alliance by himself. The battle looked to be in Raiden's favor though the sorcerers eventually defeated him.

With victory assured for both the sorcerers they turned on each other when their paranoia grew to much. Quan Chi emerged victoroius though was unable to taste victory since the reborn Dragon King entered the throne room and reclaimed his army. Quan Chi, Shang Tsung and Raiden joined forces to eliminate Onaga though they were unable to damage him. Raiden tried a suicide attack that left the palace in ruins and killed Shang Tsung in the process. Onaga survived without a scratch and Quan Chi was able to escape, but lost Shinnok's amulet in the process.

Mortal Kombat Armageddon

Quan Chi makes an unexpected return once again following Shinnok's orders. He has since reclaimed the amulet from the Dragon King and now seeks the god like power that Blaze will bestow to the one who defeats him. Under Shinnok's orders Quan Chi forms an alliance with Onaga, Shao Kahn, and Shang Tsung in the hopes that at least one of them would receive the power instead of one of the heroic fighters. Quan Chi became aware of Daegon and Taven's quest to end the conflict once and for all and was ordered by Shinnok to stop Taven.

Quan Chi located the cavern where Taven was placed in hibernation and dealt his dragon guardian Orin a mortal blow to prevent the dragon from teleporting Taven anywhere. Orin though still had enough strength to allow Taven into Outwolrd to hunt the sorcerer down. During the battle itself Quan Chi would have his leg broken by Jax, but would go on the deal Kenshi a mortal blow by impaling him on his sword, though he himself would be killed when Shang Tsung telekinetically threw him down the Pyramids flight of stairs.

Shao Kahn would become the eventual winner and defeated Blaze gaining god-like power over the realms. Raiden being the last survior sent a message back in time to try and change events so Armageddon would not come to pass ultimately changing history

Mortal Kombat 2011

Quan Chi is first shown during the first Mortal Kombat tournament where he provides his enforcer Scorpion as a contestant. Quan Chi has little part during the tournament until Liu Kang's final match before Goro where he is pitted against both Scorpion and Quan Chi. Liu Kang ultimately defeats the duo and goes on to win the tournament just like he was supposed to. During the tournament in Outworld Quan Chi is seen by Emperor Shao Kahn's side for most of the tournament and only fights King Lao along with Shang Tsung, even remarking that "No Earthrealm boy can stop this Deadly Alliance".

Kung Lao would go on to defeating them and Kintaro before being killed by Shao Kahn. Quan Chi is then show heal Kahn of his injuries by Liu Kang and proposing the Earthrealm invasion. Quan Chi with Noob Saibot in tow resurrects Sindel in Earthrealm allowing Shao Kahn to invade and merge th erealms as he see's fit. During a spell at Saint Dominique's Church where Quan Chi and Noob Saibot were sacrificing US Soldiers to summon a soulnado Noob and Quan Chi were forced to fight off Cyber Sub-Zero and Nightwolf who sabotage the spell by tossing Noob Saibot into the soulnado. Quan Chi creates a portal and isn't seen till the end of the game.

Raiden reluctantly travels to the Netherrealm to ask for Quan Chi's assistance in fighting off Outworld. When Raiden says he is willing to give up the souls of the fallen Earthrealm warriors Quan Chi reveals he already has their souls by summoning, Kitana, Jade, Sindel, Jax, Stryker, Kabal, Cyber Sub-Zero, Nightwolf, Smoke and Kung Lao. After Raiden fights off his former allies Quan Chi's words give insight into his visions and he leaves to confront Shao Kahn. After Shao Kahn's defeat and punishment by the Elder Gods Quan Chi is seen speaking with Lord Shinnok about the Netherealms impending attack of both Outworld and Earthrealm as well as Shao Kahn's stupidity at merging the realms without victory in Mortal Kombat.

Mortal Kombat (2011): "The Netherrealm has produced many vile beings, but none rival the Arch-Sorcerer Quan Chi. In lieu of Netherrealm demons, he prefers to resurrect deceased warriors for use in his sinister plans. Foremost among them is the tortured Shirai Ryu ninja Scorpion, who is Quan Chi's personal assassin. Quan Chi is building an army of such specters--the purpose of which has yet to be revealed. Another mystery is the sorcerer's involvement in the Mortal Kombat tournament. The Netherrealm has no stake in its outcome, which leads some observers to question his presence..."

Mortal Kombat vs DC Universe

After a failed invasion of Earthrealm where Shao Kahn was forced to retreat back to Outworld, Quan Chi confronted the Emperor outside the graveyard where he vocalized Shinnok's displeasure at the failed invasion. After arguing with the Emperor, Raiden appeared and confronted the two. While he argueed with Shao Kahn, Quan Chi tried to slip through a portal to escape Raiden's wrath. Shao Kahn betrayed Quan Chi and smacked him with his hammer in revenge.

Raiden the proceeded to shock Shao Kahn while he was in the portal. This sent his body spiraling into another universe where he fused with Darkseid and became Dark Kahn. Quan Chi was then imprisoned in the Netherealm by Raiden and the Elder Gods. Quan Chi remained the till the younger Sub-Zero came seeking information on the merging worlds. Quan Chi had his enforcer Scorpion fight Sub-Zero so their conflict would hasten a merging point in the Netherealm and break his bonds. Quan Chi them left Sub-Zero with a cryptic message.

If Raiden wished to defeat this merging he would have to ally himself with devils. Quan Chi then sent Scorpion to find Princess Kitana who had seen the enemy. Quan Chi then met up with Shang Tsung and instructed him to eliminate Captain Marvel, seeing him as a powerful threat. Quan Chi was able to deliver Kitana to Raiden's forces and used the last of his magic to purge her from the combat rage that blinded her. Quan Chi was noticeably absent during the final battle due to using all hus magic though he was the one to gather both sides against the DC heroes.

Characteristics

  • Height: 6'7"
  • Weight: 210 lbs
  • Nationality: Netherealm Demon
  • Martial Art: Tang Soo Do, Escrima
  • Preferred Weapons: Spiked mace, Twin Broadswords

Powers and Abilities

Quan Chi is an exceptionally powerful sorcerer in Mortal Kombat. He is capable of freely manipulating both black magic and necromancy as his main forms of magic. He can use his magic to fire skull based projectiles, summons skeletal warriors, resurrect the dead as Netherealm demons like Noob Saibot and Scorpion, and create copies of himself. Quan Chi is usually in possession of Shinnok's amulet which lets him freely traverse the realms through portals not accessible by anyone else.

Quan Chi has been show manipulating elemental forces such as magnetism for his benefit was well as shape shifting though not has naturally has Shang Tsung. Quan Chi is capable of hypnotizing his opponent into damaging themselves or leaving themselves open to an attack. Quan Chi is also a noted hand to hand combatant and swordsman being able to defeat Kenshi in a sword fight and fight off his own enforcer Scorpion.

Singature Moves

Green Flaming Skull: Quan Chi fires a skull shaped projectile that glows with an ethereal flame at his opponent.

Skull Chomp: The Upgrade to the Green Flaming Skull that adds more knock back and higher damage.

Rising Star: Quan Chi performs a slide kick to trip his opponent

Magnet Force: Quan Chi uses magnetism to keep his opponent from drawing their weapon.

Weapon Steal: The upgrade from Magnet Force where Quan Chi uses magnetism to steal his opponents weapon, disarming them.

Tele Stomp: Quan Chi teleports high into the air and comes crashing down on top of his opponent.

Sky Stomp: The upgrade to Tele Stomp where Quan Chi stomps on the opponent twice before kicking them away.

Air Throw: Quan Chi grabs the opponent in the air and forces them under him and they fall and hit the ground with only the opponent taking damage since Quan Chi uses the opponent as a buffer.

Trance: Quan Chi hypnotizes the opponent into a zombie like state and makes the walk towards them allowing for a free hit.

Ground Burst: Quan Chi points under his opponent and summons a quick burst of lightning to damage and knock back his adversary, can be done at close, medium, or long range.

Ground Blast: The upgrade to Ground Burst where Quan Chi summons a more laser looking attack that does more damage, can be done close, medium, or long range.

Skeletal Boost: Quan Chi summons a skelatal hand from the Netherealm that either boosts his damage or regenerates his health.

Skeletal Bluff: The upgrade to Skeletal boost where Quan Chi gains both a boost in damage and slow regeneration of health.

X-Ray Move - Amulet Assault: Quan Chi takes out Shinnok's amulet and blasts a flash of light into his opponents eyes. He tosses his opponent one of his green flaming skulls whic the opponent then smashes against their own skull in daze. The opponent then attempts to break their own neck and ends up fracturing the bone.

Fatalities

Fatality Steal: Quan Chi performs the 2nd fatality of his opponent.

Leg Beatdown: Quan Chi's signature fatality where he rips off his opponents leg and beats them to death with it.

Neck Stretch: Quan Chi jumps on his opponents shoulders and stretches their neck to an impossible length by using his magic

On Your Knees: Quan Chi make an ethereal sword and slices the opponents legs off, The opponent still stands in their stumps when Quan Chi slices of their head, but catches it before it hits the ground and show it off as a sign of victory.

deck: Krol was Gotham City's former Mayor and a big supporter of Batman however he never liked Jim Gordon very much.
description:
Armond Krol was the mayor of Gotham City.A hard line politician,Krol often criticized Commissioner James Gordon for his leniency when it came to vigilantism-particularly, his reluctance to bring down the cowled crusader known as Batman. Krol's attitude towards the Batman changed however, when the Batman saved his life after being imprisoned inside of a dungeon filled with water.It was shortly after this incident that Bruce Wayne was injured following an assault by the criminal Bane and was forced to relinquish the mantle of the Batman to a surrogate - Jean-Paul Valley. Jean-Paul was a brutal combatant, known for hospitalizing and at times even killing his adversaries. Krol, unaware that this Batman was not the same man who once saved his life, publicly championed Jean-Paul's actions. As it turned out, James Gordon, who was once the Batman's largest supporter, now decried the actions of this new Batman and the bitterness between Krol and he intensified. Armand Krol soon removed Gordon from his position as Gotham's police commissioner and replaced him with Gordon's wife, Sarah Essen. Krol's political career came to an end when he lost a re-election campagin against mayoral prospect Marion Grange. A short while later, global eco-terorist Ra's al Ghul released a deadly virus called the Clench in Gotham City. Armand Krol was one of hundreds of people who contracted the virus and died in his penthouse soon after.
